xxl.core.io.raw
Class SeekMapperRawAccess

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.raw.DecoratorRawAccess
      xxl.core.io.raw.SeekMapperRawAccess
All Implemented Interfaces:
RawAccess
public class SeekMapperRawAccess
extends DecoratorRawAccess

If you have a big hard drive and only relatively small data, then possibly all data is on the same physical cylinder. So, no seeks will be performed. To test the algorithm under the influence of seeks, you can use this class which to map an existing RawAccess. When moving to the next sector, a seek of 2^sequentialSeekDistanceExponent sectors is performed.

Only those sectors are mapped which have a number below the largest x with 2^x<=numberOfSectors.

In the example in the main method, a raw access of 18 sectors is mapped with different seek distance exponents (2 and 3).

Field Detail

sequentialSeekDistanceExponent

protected int sequentialSeekDistanceExponent
The exponent to the base 2 of the seek distance. The seek from sector n to sector n+1 will be mapped to a seek distance of 2^sequentialSeekDistanceExponent.

Constructor Detail

                           int sequentialSeekDistanceExponent)
Constructs a new RawAccess which maps the sector numbers to new ones (Permutation).

Parameters:
ra - RawAccess which is mapped.
sequentialSeekDistanceExponent - The exponent to the base 2 of the seek distance. The seek from sector n to sector n+1 will be mapped to a seek distance of 2^sequentialSeekDistanceExponent.
